channel.title: How to share table files between patches?
channel.description: How can I save a table to a file in one patch and open it in another? The problem I've been running into is that table/load and table/save seem to restrict the file locations to the directory of the patch; preventing me from accessing those tables in another project. I'm building an instrument similar to the "Modulin" built by wintergatan (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFfe4ZRQOH8) and I need to calibrate my ribbon; but I'd like to not have to do that every time I load a new project; instead have one patch dedicated to calibration (which is a 5 minute process to get the values for the calibration table) and then have all other patches read the table it created. Screen Shot 2017-09-13 at 1.22.50 AM This image shows an example of my problem. In the string, I never specified it to be in 0:/untitled/ but it put it there anyway. Is there a way to circumvent this, and have it access 0:/oijjioijojiouhio instead of 0:/untitled/oijjioijojiouhio? (oijjioijojiouhio is a random keyboard-smash name; its not specifically important)

item.title: How to share table files between patches?
item.dc:creator: @TenOutOfNothing Ryan Burgert
item.description:
@TenOutOfNothing wrote:

Thank you! That worked

item.title: How to share table files between patches?
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Put a / in front
E.g.

/myfile.txt
This will put in root directory.

Read full topic
item.source: How to share table files between patches?

item.title: How to share table files between patches?
item.dc:creator: @TenOutOfNothing Ryan Burgert
item.description:
@TenOutOfNothing wrote:

How can I save a table to a file in one patch and open it in another?
The problem I've been running into is that table/load and table/save seem to restrict the file locations to the directory of the patch; preventing me from accessing those tables in another project.

I'm building an instrument similar to the "Modulin" built by wintergatan (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mFfe4ZRQOH8) and I need to calibrate my ribbon; but I'd like to not have to do that every time I load a new project; instead have one patch dedicated to calibration (which is a 5 minute process to get the values for the calibration table) and then have all other patches read the table it created.

image.png2026x336 31.1 KB
Screen Shot 2017-09-13 at 1.22.50 AM

This image shows an example of my problem. In the string, I never specified it to be in 0:/untitled/ but it put it there anyway. Is there a way to circumvent this, and have it access 0:/oijjioijojiouhio instead of 0:/untitled/oijjioijojiouhio?

(oijjioijojiouhio is a random keyboard-smash name; its not specifically important)

Read full topic
